title: ICICI, Axis, IIFL invest in GMR's Rs 800 crore Delhi Airport bonds
description: ICICI Bank, Axis Bank, and India Infrastructure Finance Ltd (IIFL) have collectively subscribed to ₹800 crore bonds issued by GMR group-promoted Delhi International Airport. The bonds, raised for 10 years at an annualised coupon of 9.84% with a reset clause at the end of five years, will finance the capital expenditure for phase 3A expansion at Indira Gandhi International Airport. Last week, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank invested ₹300 crore each, while IIFL invested ₹200 crore in the bonds, which are linked to the repo rate with a spread cap and floor.
